title: Germany and France now publicly display their disagreements over Macron's proposals
subhed: Friedrich Merz's government has criticized the idea of a joint European loan and the push for European preference in goods purchases advocated by Emmanuel Macron. These disagreements come on top of tensions over the Mercosur trade deal and how to use frozen Russian assets.

title: Trump revokes key climate finding, dismantling legal basis for emissions rules
A business ecosystem thrives on Trump's anti-migrant policies
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Former EU commissioner Thierry Breton sees himself as a savior for Europe
subhed: The French politician, a vocal critic of Ursula von der Leyen, is preparing a plan for the European Union to 'regain its sovereignty' starting in 2027.

title: In Senegal, crackdown on LGBTQ+ people intensifies
subhed: In early February, authorities in Dakar arrested 12 people accused of 'acts against nature.' Openly homophobic rhetoric has spread, while human rights defenders have been forced into silence.

title: Ultra-fast fashion giants like Shein and secondhand platforms such as Vinted disrupt France's fashion sector
subhed: In 2025, clothing sales declined by 1.6%, according to figures from the Institut Français de la Mode published on Thursday. However, the share of online sales is increasing.

title: Ice hockey at the 2026 Olympics: A mountain sport looks to win over France's big cities
subhed: The majority of players on the French national team hail from urban centers. This shift reflects the changing landscape of the sport across the country.

title: Los Angeles fires: California launches investigation into claims of late warnings in Black neighborhoods
US's low unemployment rate masks lack of job growth
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Europe's growing mistrust of the United States
France calls Francesca Albanese, UN rapporteur for the Palestinian territories, to resign
'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhed: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: France's demographics debate focuses on birth rates while ignoring touchier measures
subhed: Politicians have struggled to address the various aspects of France's current demographic shift. The debate on the issue remains focused on boosting birth rates, while steering clear of more sensitive topics such as immigration or the retirement age.
byline: By Julie Carriat and Solène Cordier

title: How the Epstein scandal brought down Jack Lang
subhed: The emblematic minister from President François Mitterrand's era was forced to step down as president of the Arab World Institute in Paris. Former allies and rivals have begun to speak out about a man who used his influence and network to maintain a lavish lifestyle.
